holidays.name: National Garlic Day
holidays.description: A flavorful celebration honoring the pungent, versatile garlic bulb that spices up kitchens worldwide.
holidays.origin: While not an official federal holiday, garlic enthusiasts and cooks across the globe have adopted April 19 to pay tribute to this powerful ingredient.
holidays.funFact: Garlic has been used for over 7,000 years for its medicinal properties and was believed to ward off evil and vampires!

holidays.name: Earth Day (early observance)
holidays.description: Though Earth Day‚Äôs main celebration is April 22, some communities kick off eco-friendly events on April 19, encouraging early environmental awareness and action.
holidays.origin: Inspired by the original 1970 Earth Day to promote environmental protection.
holidays.funFact: April 19 observances often include tree planting and community cleanups as a warm-up for the big Earth Day.

holidays.name: Bicycle Day
holidays.description: Commemorates the first intentional LSD trip taken by Dr. Albert Hofmann, who famously experienced its mind-expanding effects while riding his bicycle home.
holidays.origin: On April 19, 1943, Hofmann ingested LSD and cycled home, marking a milestone in psychedelic history.
holidays.funFact: Bicycle Day celebrations often include bike rides and psychedelic art exhibitions honoring drug culture and scientific discovery.
